intro: Linaria aparinoides, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Linaria aparinoides is often used in rock gardens and as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and vibrant color.
